intro: Pinalia marginata, commonly known as the marginate pinalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinctive margin. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
